author: Jen Skerritt
description: Canada’s dairy industry, which receives tariff and quota protections from its government, has drawn the ire of U.S. President Donald Trump, who blames Canada for millions of dollars in lost sales for U.S. milk producers. In this, Trump isn’t alone. Other nations also worry that Canada may start dumping low-cost milk products on the international market, exacerbating a global glut that’s weighed on prices and led to losses all over the world.
title: Why Milk Creates Anger Across U.S.-Canada Border: QuickTake Q&A

author: Doug Alexander
description: HSBC Holdings Plc is getting aggressive in Canada -- and one needs to look no further than its latest mortgage rate for proof of broader ambitions.
title: HSBC Makes 'Big Bet' on Canada in Bid for More Market Share

author: By Joe Sheppard For Mailonline
description: The terrifying incident took place at the Steveston Fisherman's Wharf in Richmond B.C., Canada as tourists watched the animal looking for fish.
title: Sea lion grabs girl from pier and drags her underwater

author: Tim Hepher and Alwyn Scott
description: Two words underpin Boeing's (BA.N) decision to launch a U.S. trade complaint against Bombardier (BBDb.TO), which plunged it into a row with Canada last week: "Never again".
title: In Bombardier fight, Boeing sees ghost of Airbus ascent

author: Will Worley
description: Richard Oakes was a Native American activist best known for leading the occupation of the disused Alcatraz prison, which was credited with changing the narrative around indigenous peoples' rights.  He was shot and killed in 1972 but would have turned 75 today, and a Google Doodle has been created in his honour. Oakes was a member of the Mohawk tribe, who originated in the north eastern United States and south eastern Canada.
title: Richard Oakes would have turned 75 today. This is what he did for Native American rights.
